name: CreateApmRetentionFilter
description:
Create a retention filter for indexing spans in Datadog.

Use this tool to create a retention filter in Datadog that indexes spans within your organization. Note that default filters of types spans-errors-sampling-processor and spans-appsec-sampling-processor cannot be created. This tool returns the definition of the newly created retention filter.

parameters.name: search_query
parameters.description: The search query using span search syntax to define criteria for retention.

value_schema.description: The search query - following the [span search syntax](https://docs.datadoghq.com/tracing/trace_explorer/query_syntax/).

parameters.name: retention_filter_type
parameters.description: Set the type of retention filter. Must be 'spans-sampling-processor'.

value_schema.description: The type of retention filter. The value should always be spans-sampling-processor.

parameters.name: retention_filter_name
parameters.description: The name for the retention filter to be created.

value_schema.description: The name of the retention filter.

parameters.name: span_sample_rate
parameters.description: Sample rate for spans matching the query. A value of 1.0 processes all matching spans.

value_schema.description:
Sample rate to apply to spans going through this retention filter.
A value of 1.0 keeps all spans matching the query.

parameters.name: resource_type
parameters.description: Specify the type of the resource, always use 'apm_retention_filter'.

parameters.name: enable_retention_filter
parameters.description: Set to true to enable the retention filter or false to disable it.

parameters.name: trace_sample_rate
parameters.description: Sample rate for traces with spans going through the filter. Use 1.0 to keep all matching traces.

value_schema.description:
Sample rate to apply to traces containing spans going through this retention filter.
A value of 1.0 keeps all traces with spans matching the query.
